message: Not at all a fan and if you remove it, it breaks the links to the group in the nav because it wants to go to that topic
i dont like it
Gross
when selecting a group from the top menu i expect to enter that group and see a list of topics. now i get to the "welcome..." topic instead. this is completely counter-intuitive. please undo!

@EisFrei well of course when you just start it will not have content, the admins of the groups should fill it first, and it is suppose to be a place i thinking of where new users can see what kind of things go on inside the chat or ask questions so that is why i said "think" of it as a MOTD
I think of it as a MOTD and it isnt bad it is good
when changing the title of the automatically generated topic it will remain "welcome to ..." in the "recent topics". did i already mention that i don't think this "feature" is a good idea?
@italiano40 how is an automatically generated topic – without any content – a MOTD?
still not convinced. i think i'll fix this with a little greasemonkey voodoo

I'm also disliking this new setup, especially the fact that selecting something from the Groups menu at the top throws you into this generic topic with no content. It's a confusing experience. It may be a good idea in theory, but I don't see many people really jumping in to post content to those topics.
I also agree with the general sentiment here. I would rather it be left up to the group admins to define and curate a `Welcome` convoreseation.
oh ok that's what it is, a feature :). I was a little confused.
I do not totally object to the new Welcome bot-topic, but it's annoying because I can't change it to the language or message I want to use.
@yungyuc It should be editable just like any other topic...is it not letting you edit it for some reason?
@ericflo I see! Somehow the edit button is partially covered by the Create new topic button.  Thanks a lot.
I like the idea of the general room, although I do feel tricked when I click on the any of the links in the group menu (expecting list of topics).

I really don't like this, I've seen it in another group (Hacker News?) where they came up with the idea that the, "Welcome to...," topic could be sticky but when you go through the group you still end up with the topic list. This is the best solution in my mind, the new step, of going to the "Welcome to..." ruins the interaction process I have with the site.
I just noticed even an admin can't delete this "Welcome to" topic added by the bot. That really s....
@craigshipp but you can rename it
@italiano40 yes, but IMO admins for a group should have the option of removing any topic in the group regardless of who or what created it. Otherwise why call them admins?
wait... u guys are admins?
The topic's name will still show as Welcome to [group] everywhere except in the topic itself
no, sorry, not on the list, only in the recent topics
i like the idea of a welcome topic (in fact I suggested that feature during the alpha-test phase) but I don't think they should have been retroactively applied to existing groups
@djchall it feels even more weird that you can't click into a group without entering the welcome topic first
or replies/messages
it feels weird to be "welcomed" to a group that you've been participating in several months
the bot even added this to private groups. what's the reason for this?
@craigshipp We're trying to create a lobby where people can just chat
@EisFrei yeah, that bugs me too
it was completely confusing when i went into my old company's alumni group this morning
i was like "where did all the posts go"
at least renaming the topic works now, though the url is still welcome-to-[group], but that's fine
We're listening to the feedback though, thanks for letting us know what you think
@ericflo yes, but a private group should be private or am I missing something here?
@craigshipp We want private groups to have this lobby to hang out and chat in too
@ericflo so maybe we need private private groups for those of us who want a private group that's actually private :)
@craigshipp I apologize for any confusion
Group administrators are free to change the topic name, by the way
@craigshipp I think we're miscommunicating...
Correct
@craigshipp Yes it is private
@craigshipp Private groups are still private
Nobody can see into them
but didn't you say they can chat in the welcome section?
@craigshipp Only people who are members of the private group
but not the url
OK, that sounds good but in that case we don't need the welcome message because only those that we invited are there. No big deal.
@craigshipp Ahh yeah I see, maybe we worded it wrong by calling it "welcome to..." because it's supposed to be mostly a lobby for general chat.
adding a lobby on your own is just 2 clicks and typing a name away. forcing one uppon each group seems a bit overkill
@ericflo just give us the ability to delete it and then problem solved!
Thanks for the feedback guys
Would be nice to have an option [ ] show lobby / [ ] show topics
Featured topics would allow admins to create their own "Welcome" or "General" topics that appear above the "Recent Topics" another possible solution.
@ericflo just because we love convore!
Really annoys me that a click on a group now takes me to an empty topic. I then have to "think" where to click to get back to the list. Is contrary to the whole "don't make me have to think" ethos.
Ok all, we've just changed it so that it doesn't send you directly to the welcome topic
@ericflo *clicks the star button a bajillion times*
now a delete option and we're home free!
Thank you!
Amazing, thank you!
i also like the "username icon scroll over show thing"
YESYESYESYESYES. i love how the site creators actually listen, unlike other sites. ex: youtube
I also like the fact that the welcome topic has a different look.
the new way feels good. My first thought just now was yay that's the way.
@ericflo I edited the topic title to nothing and now I can't edit the title anymore
@ericflo in the all topics list it appears as blank, but in the left widget you can see the regular name
would definitely like a delete option for that topic
i sometimes cant login and says am forbidden wHY?
